topic: AR/VR in the Classroom: What the 2025 Evidence Really Shows
target_audience: edtech buyers, curriculum teams, STEM educators

refs.ref_string: Li et al. (2025) AR in Higher Ed meta-analysis
refs.content: Meta-analysis (2000–2023) estimating overall AR effect size and moderators (immersion, duration, domain).
Across 21 experimental studies VR shows ES≈0.64 on learning, larger for immersive VR (ES≈1.11).
Notes growing adoption of VR and documentation of student success; contextualizes adoption trends.

special_instructions: Give procurement checklist (hardware, hygiene, content licensing), equity/access notes, and when non-immersive options are sufficient.
